title: About
text:
Hi! My name is Payton and I am a native Michigander with a love of the outdoors, people, and all things related to Taylor Swift. Pictured above are some of my nearest and dearest, as well as some of my hobbies including Martial Arts (Hapkido, Judo) and film photography (some of the pics above are from my film camera)! I adore reading classic literature (I am a Shakespeare collector), poetry, and of course fantasy/romance novels. Not pictured, but just as important, I am an avid baker who constantly loves to bring in baked goods for my colleagues and students alike.
While Statistics is my professional passion I find just as much joy in creative expression and human connection. I am constantly inspired by the stories data can tell - and the stories we tell beyond the numbers.

title: Teaching
text: I prioritize building a supportive environment where students can actively explore and apply statistics and data science. I‚Äôve helped design hands-on activities and real-world data projects that connect theory to practice, helping students see the relevance of concepts beyond the classroom. I focus on demystifying complex mathematical and programming ideas by breaking them into manageable steps and encouraging peer collaboration. By consistently inviting questions and feedback, I tailor my instruction to address individual challenges and promote growth. Ultimately, I want students not only to understand statistics technically but to develop the confidence to analyze data critically and communicate their insights clearly.

title: Research
text:
My research centers on developing and applying statistical methods to better understand complex ecological and environmental systems. I am especially interested in geospatial data analysis, non-parametric methods, and Bayesian modeling, which provide powerful tools for capturing spatial structure and uncertainty in ecological processes. My work often engages with real-world data from environmental and agricultural contexts, where flexible modeling and thoughtful inference are essential.
I am currently working with Dr.¬†Jarad Niemi for my Ph.D.

Student Reviews

title: Teaching
text:
üìù What My Students Say




‚ÄúPayton‚Äôs easy going nature and the effort she put into class to help us learn. She deserves more credit for her hard work. She made stats understandable to me and not scary.‚Äù - Spring 2023


‚ÄúPayton is a lovely instructor, please pay her a million dollars and give her a degree asap.‚Äù - Spring 2023


‚ÄúI really liked the format: it was consistent, and the labs and homework more than prepared me for the exams. Despite being in a big room and this being a gen-ed course that a lot of students have to take, I thought the lectures were engaging! The instructor seemed to enjoy teaching and was almost always in a good mood, etc.‚Äù - Spring 2024


‚Äú‚Ä¶despite not being super interested in math/more quantitative stuff, I thought the course was well-designed, and I might even say I enjoy statistics a little bit now. .‚Äù - Fall 2024
